newsitem.title: FRANCE: Usinor best placed in race for CSI - paper.
newsitem.headline: Usinor best placed in race for CSI - paper.

text.p: Spain may favour a bid placed by by Usinor Sacilor in the privatisation of steel group Corporacion Siderurgica Integral (CSI), French daily La Tribune reported on Thursday.
Usinor Sacilor could not be immediately reached for comments.

La Tribune said other international contenders included British Steel and Italian group Riva. But La Tribune said, citing sources at Spain's industry ministry, that British Steel may have dropped of the race. British Steel could not be immediately reached for comment.
La Tribune also said Spanish authorities would like the foreign contender to be part of a consortium majority- controlled by local Spanish interests.
Spain may decide on the bids by next spring.
Usinor Sacilor already controls stakes in two CSI units, Sidmed and Galmed.
